title: General Sample Description - stages defined here apply to all description instances
description: Definitions for elements that appear in different stages of a wizard targeted: 'ref', id of stage; 'title',  header used for the stage; items, actual form elements on the page; 'is_singular_stage', if all items must have same value for this stage

properties.title: Number of Samples
properties.message: Enter the number of samples you want to describe. You can describe multiple samples having a common set of attributes.

items.help_tip: Enter number of samples to be described
items.label: How many samples do you want to describe?

properties.title: Sample Type
properties.message: Please specify the sample type. This will enable the wizard to select an appropriate metadata template for your sample description.

items.label: What sample type do you want to base this description?

properties.title: Sample Clone
properties.message: Sample cloning is a way of bootstrapping sample description, and can help speed up the description process. You can choose to clone an existing sample. Alternatively, you can clone from a remote service by providing a sample accession.

items.help_tip: Please specify if, and how, you want to clone a sample
items.label: Do you want to clone a sample?

option_values.label: Yes - Clone a Profile sample
option_values.description: Select this option if you want to clone an existing sample in your work profile.

option_values.label: Yes - Clone a Biosample
option_values.description: Select this option if you want to clone a sample from the Biosample repository.

option_values.label: No
option_values.description: Select this option if you do not want to clone a sample.

properties.title: Clone Existing
properties.message: Select an existing sample to clone. Existing samples are limited to those already defined within the current profile.

items.help_tip: Select an existing sample to clone
items.label: Sample

properties.title: Clone Biosample
properties.message: Enter a Biosample accession to resolve. A Biosample accession is of the form: 'SAMEA214394'

items.help_tip: Enter sample accession to resolve, then click the Resolve! button
items.label: Biosample Accession

properties.title: Naming method
properties.message: You can name your samples by supplying predefined names (already captured elsewhere, e.g., spreadsheet). Another option is to let COPO generate sample names from a supplied 'bundle' name.

items.help_tip: Specify how your sample names will be provided
items.label: How do you want to name your samples?

option_values.label: Predefined Names
option_values.description: I want to supply predefined sample names.

option_values.label: Bundle Name
option_values.description: I want to supply a 'bundle name', from which individual sample names can be derived.

properties.title: Sample Name
properties.message:
Enter your predefined sample names as tab or comma delimited values in the space provided.
Please note that the supplied names will be validated against existing sample names for uniqueness.

items.help_tip: Enter your predefined sample names as tab or comma delimited values (e.g., SMPXY_1EU, SMPXY_2EU, SMPXY_3BF). Note: you have to click the validate button for the proposed sample names to be validated and registered.
items.label: Predefined Names

properties.title: Sample Name
properties.message:
Enter a ‘bundle name’ that will form the base part from which individual sample names can be derived.
Please note that the generated names will be validated against existing sample names for uniqueness.

items.help_tip: Enter a bundle name and click 'Validate!'. Generated sample names will be of the form: SMPXY_1, SMPXY_2, etc., where the 'SMPXY' part of the generated names is the entry you provide here.
items.label: Bundle Name

properties.title: Sample Attributes
properties.message: Enter the attributes that describe your sample(s). Attributes entered in this stage will be used to generate individual samples. If attributes are from a cloned sample, please check to ensure that they are well aligned with your metadata needs.

properties.title: Edit Samples
properties.message: Edit individual samples to complete the description.
